page.title: 16The Fireman
page.content: My name is Paul Wood and my father works at Plympton Fire Station. About 130 men are employed at the Fire Station as firemen. They share duties including answering the phone. When seven vacencies were advertised 3000 people applied for the jobs. In the Fire Station there is a house used for training. Dummies are placed in the house and the firemen have to rescue them. The dummies weigh 16 stone. The rooms are filled with smoke as if the house was realy on fire. All the firemen have to drill. They pracise using the hoses and putting them back into the Fire Engine. They have to check that their breathing apparatus works and also practise wearing it. When they return from a fire they have to clean all their equipment.
